channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Homeland Security whistleblowers 'betrayed' by Biden administration win back jobs, pay
item.description: The Trump administration gave back pay and promotions to three Customs and Border Protection officials who suffered demotions and other retaliation af...

item.title: Red state school district slapped with complaint to Trump admin alleging unlawful DEI practices
item.description: A school district outside Columbus, Ohio has been hit with a legal complaint over its DEI policies by a pro-Trump legal group alleging its violating t...

item.title: China’s Rising Naval Dominance Threatens U.S. Commerce And Safety
item.description: China’s race to be a maritime superpower presents the greatest threat to the U.S. since the British burned down the White House in 1814.

item.title: Young Canadians Voted Against Spending Orgy, But Their Insulated Parents Won
item.description: Younger Canadians stuck living with their parents and unable to afford starting families supported the Conservative Party. Liberals won.

item.title: Bill Gates says lack of climate cooperation is unlikely to last
item.description: Unwinding global collaborations to address climate change “works against us,” Gates said.

item.title: Powell won’t cut interest rates on Wednesday, Wharton’s Jeremy Siegel says. He suspects attacks on the Fed chair will escalate
item.description: “Powell is not going to do anything,” Siegel said in an interview. “Trump, I think, is going to step up the escalation,” he said later.

item.title: Trump says Stephen Miller at top of the list for national security adviser
item.description: President Trump said Deputy Chief of Staff for Policy Stephen Miller is the leading contender to fill the role of national security adviser.

item.title: Democrat Hank Johnson draws Holocaust comparison while blasting deportations
item.description: Rep. Hank Johnson, D-Ga., was mocked for appearing to compare deportations to the Holocaust.

item.title: Pope Don, &c.
item.description: On Trump and the GOP; capitalism and imperialism; the Epstein case; notable centenarians; and more.

item.title: America Must Lead in the Middle East with Strength, Not Slogans
item.description: U.S. leadership can’t be built on one-off deals or delusions of grand bargains.

item.title: Rwanda 'in discussions' with US to receive deported migrants: report
item.description: Rwandan Foreign Minister Olivier Nduhungirehe said his country is "in discussions with the United States" to receive migrants deported by the Trump ad...

item.title: Congress Should Decide Harvard’s Tax Exemption
item.description: The Supreme Court should never have made the president the arbiter of the community’s conscience in deciding when colleges must be taxed.

item.title: 94-year-old Warren Buffett isn’t retiring from Berkshire Hathaway and its $348 billion cash pile just yet
item.description: The billionaire will remain chairman of the board at Berkshire Hathaway when vice chairman Greg Abel takes over.

item.title: GOP leaders find new major holiday deadline for Trump's 'big, beautiful bill' amid Medicaid, tax divisions
item.description: Republicans are now hoping that Independence Day will serve as a good deadline to pass their plans for reconciliation.

item.title: 'MOGE' audit uncovers nonprofits' 'incredibly wasteful' spending of taxpayer funds: state official
item.description: Wasteful spending as far away as Manhattan was found in an audit of HIV/AIDS grants by Mississippi state auditor Shad White.

item.title: DHS to pay illegal immigrants $1,000 to self-deport
item.description: Homeland Security said Monday that it will pay a $1,000 reward to illegal immigrants who self-deport out of the U.S.

item.title: Warren Buffett credits Apple CEO Tim Cook with making ‘a lot more money than I’ve ever made’ for Berkshire Hathaway
item.description: Apple was a rare tech investment for Buffett, who always preferred to think of the iPhone-maker as a consumer goods company.

item.title: Pope Trump Goes Up in Orange Smoke
item.description: The nonsense we talk about vs. rare spiritual opportunities.

item.title: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott signs sweeping school voucher law
item.description: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott has signed the nation's largest school voucher program into law, authorizing education savings accounts for parents to spend ta...

item.title: It Took Me Only 30 Seconds To Order Deadly Abortion Pills In A State Where They’re Illegal
item.description: Like an Amazon for abortion pills, Plan C proudly boasts it can help users obtain 'pills by mail in every state.'

item.title: Millions of student loan borrowers head to collections as delinquency rates soar over 20%
item.description: Some will have wages and benefits garnished, putting even more strain on an already unstable economy.

item.title: Wall Street slumps over Trump's latest tariff threat on films
item.description: President Trump's proposal to slap a 100% tariff on movies produced outside the U.S. reverberated across Wall Street markets Monday.

item.title: FDA Commissioner Can’t Ignore Damning New Data On The Dangers Of Mifepristone
item.description: It’s time for the Trump administration to put back in place the safety regulations on mifepristone without delay.

item.title: There’s No Way to Replace the Income Tax with Tariffs
item.description: Even if it could raise enough revenue (which it can’t), it would undercut Trump’s other tariff goals.

item.title: The Last Thing America Needs Right Now Is War With Iran
item.description: As pressure mounts for yet another regime-change war — this time with Iran — it is imperative that the U.S. resist calls for escalation.

item.title: How Tariffs Could Accelerate America’s AI Revolution: Implications for Investors
item.description: Discover how new US tariffs could accelerate AI adoption, reshape American industry, and unlock long-term investment opportunities amid economic disru...

item.title: When the Equity Premium Fades, Alpha Shines
item.description: As the equity risk premium declines, alpha becomes critical. Discover how investors can adapt through factor strategies and global diversification.

item.title: Rethinking the Institutional Mandate: A Compilation from Enterprising Investor
item.description: Here's a curated look at where institutional investing is under strain—and where forward-looking strategies offer paths to improve performance, oversi...

item.title: The Missing Link in Cross-Border Healthcare M&A: Finance-Led Integration
item.description: Finance teams play a vital role in cross-border healthcare M&A. This blog offers a framework for driving integration success through strategic finance...

item.title: Resilience Is the New Alpha: Rethinking Risk in a Fragile World
item.description: The market has stopped applauding good intentions and started testing whether companies can withstand the world's mess.
